case_vignette: a 32-year-old woman presents with an itchy rash that began 3 months ago. she has a history of anxiety but otherwise no known medical conditions. she has tried over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream to treat the rash, finding some relief from the itchiness, but the rash continues to spread. she has no known allergies and has not changed her skin care products or medications. on examination, the patient has dark purple and gray flat-topped papules with fine gray-white streaks on her flexural wrists, dorsal hands, elbows, ankles, and dorsal feet.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have an itchy rash that has been spreading for about 3 months.
Where on your body did the rash first appear and where has it spread to?
The rash first appeared on my wrists and has spread to my hands, elbows, ankles, and feet.
Have you noticed any specific triggers that seem to worsen the rash, such as certain foods, stress, or environmental factors?
No, I haven't noticed any specific triggers that worsen the rash.
Do you have any known allergies or a personal or family history of eczema, asthma, or allergic rhinitis?
I have no known allergies and no history of eczema, asthma, or allergic rhinitis.
Have you started any new medications, soaps, detergents, or been exposed to new materials or chemicals around the time the rash began?
No, I have not changed my skin care products, medications, or been exposed to new materials or chemicals.
Do the affected areas show any scaly patches, blisters, or is the rash just red and itchy?
The affected areas have dark purple and gray flat-topped bumps with fine gray-white streaks; they are itchy but do not have scaly patches or blisters.
Final Diagnosis: Lichen Planus.
